metadata.title: Lumen to Lux Calculator – Beam Angle, Distance & Real Photometry
metadata.description: Professional lumen-to-lux calculator using real photometric geometry: distance, beam angle, inverse square law, and solid angle Ω. Accurate for LEDs, spotlights, indoor lighting and engineering verification.

introduction: This advanced lumen-to-lux calculator uses true photometric geometry. Unlike simple converters, lux cannot be derived from lumens without specifying distance and beam angle.
You get engineering-grade accuracy based on the inverse square law and the solid angle of the optical beam.
methodology: Lux is defined as E = Φ / A, but real luminaires do not illuminate a flat 1 m² area. The illuminated area depends on distance and the cone of light.
The tool uses the exact solid-angle formula Ω = 2π(1 − cos(θ/2)) and then applies E = Φ / (Ω d²).
This matches the methodology discussed in professional lighting design, LED photometry, and the analysis provided in metrological reports.
examples: 1000 lm spotlight, 60° beam, 1 m distance → ~1190 lux
Same lamp but 30° beam → ~4700 lux (narrow beams massively increase lux)
